channel.title: Dessert on the papers
channel.description: Recent content in Dessert on the papers

item.title: caramelized milk
item.description:
ingredients

3.5 cups    whole milk
1/2 cup     heavy cream
230 g       sugar

instructions

  • mix together in a dutch oven
  • cook over med-low heat until reduces to 400g

notes

This is used to make pumpkin-pie but can be used any other time caramelzied milk is needed.

item.title: cheem cream
item.description:
ingredients

226g    softened cream cheese
2 tbs   softened butter
100g    powdered sugar
1 tsp   vanilla
1 tsp   black pepper

instructions

  • mix ingredients together thoroughly

notes

great on oatmeal-cream-pies or [[shortbread-cookies]]. named by jade thornton when we lived together and i made it for [[brownies]]

item.title: custard
item.description:
ingredients

300 g   sugar
1 cup   whole milk or fruit juice
60 g    flour
8       room temp eggs

instructions

notes

for lemon flavor, add zest of 3 lemons and 1 cup or 240ml fresh lemon juice

item.title: Duck Chocolate Cake
item.description:
ingredients

1.75 cups     all purpose flour
0.75 cup      cocoa powder
1.5  tsp      baking powder
1.5  tsp      baking soda
2    cup      white sugar
1    tsp      salt
2             eggs
1    cup      milk
0.5  cup      vegetable oil
2    tsp      vanilla extract
1    cup      boiling water

instructions

  • mix dry ingredients
  • add eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla
  • add boiling water, whisking to incorporate
  • pour batter into cake pans
  • bake for 35 minutes

notes

Kate made this for me for my 29th birthday. She dressed it with whipped cream and a chocolate whipped cream duck. A super light and airy cake.

item.title: fiona's scones
item.description:
ingredients

450g      self rising flour
2 tsp     baking powder
50g       castor sugar
100g      butter
2         eggs
~ 2 cups  milk or alternative

instructions

  • mix dry ingredients in a bowl
  • kneed in softened butter, you’re making biscuits!
  • mix milk and eggs in a separate cup, save a little
  • mix in wet ingredients
  • roll out 1/4 inch thick, cut with old-fashioned biscuit cutters
  • dip top in milk mixture, then into sugar
  • bake for 12-15 minutes, turn halfway

notes

these are traditionally served with clotted cream. also great with jam or marmalade

item.title: mag's pound cake
item.description:
ingredients

3    cups    sugar
1    cups    butter
1/2  cups    vegetable oil
5            eggs
1    cup     milk
1    tsp     vanilla
3    cups    flour
1/2  tsp     baking powder
1/2  tsp     salt
--------------------------
*optionals*
5    zested  lemons
2/3  cups    cocoa powder
5    zested  oranges

instructions

  • if using zest, pulse with sugar in food processor until well combined.
  • cream together butter and sugar
  • add oil, eggs, then milk (very slow)
  • mix dry ingredients in a separate bowl, slowly add to wet mixture
  • bake in cold oven
    • place cake in cold oven, set to 325f
    • once pre-heated, bake for 15min more at 325f
    • after, bump oven to 345f and bake another 45min
    • rotate, then another 30-45min
  • optional - glaze with perfect-icing or your favorite glaze

item.title: oatmeal cream pies
item.description:
ingredients

1.5    cups    butter or shortening
2      cups    brown sugar
1/2    cup     molasses or maple syrup
2              eggs
4.5    cups    oat flour
4      tsp     baking soda
1      tsp     salt

instructions

  • cream butter, sugar, molasses, and egg until fluffy
  • sift together flour, soda, and salt
  • mix everything together. form small balls and roll in sugar
  • bake for 12 min in preheated oven
  • cool on drying rack for 10-15 min
  • spread [[cheem-cream]] lightly on two cookies and sandwich together

notes

zoe came up with these based on a [[gingerbread-snaps]] recipe you can find in that old gingham cookbook every grandma in the south owns.

item.title: perfect icing
item.description:
ingredients

100g       confectioners sugar
1    tbs   milk
1/2  tsp   vanilla
--------------------------
*optionals*
1    tbs   milk (unflavored)
1    tbs   lemon juice (lemon flavor)
25g        cocao powder (chocolate)

instructions

  • mix all ingredients together thoroughly, keep chilled
  • try flavoring with orange juice, mulled zest, mulled fruit, melted chocolate, instant or brewed coffee & more!

item.title: pie crust
item.description:
ingredients

300 g    flour
13 g     sugar
5 g      sea salt
1 cup    cold butter
~ 1 cup  ice water

instructions

  • mix dry ingredients, kneed in butter
  • slowly add in water
  • roll out to 1/4" thick. save leftover for top
  • bake at 400 for 15 min
  • pull from oven, add pie crust weights, bake another 10-15 min

item.title: pound cake cookies
item.description:
ingredients

1/2  cups    butter
1.5  cups    sugar
1/2  cups    vegetable oil
2            eggs
1    tsp     vanilla
3    cups    flour
1    tsp     baking powder
1/2  tsp     salt
--------------------------
*optionals*
4    zested  lemons

instructions

  • mix together like [[mags-pound-cake]]
  • let dough set in fridge for minimum 3 hours
  • bake in 350f oven for 10-15min until edges turn golden brown like a pound cake
  • glaze with perfect-icing or your favorite glaze recipe

notes

these were an accidental recipe i came up with after messing up mags-pound-cake. they’re a hit, especially the lemon ones!

item.title: pumpkin pie
item.description:
ingredients

425 g    roasted pumkin puree
400 g    caramelized milk
2        eggs
1        egg yolk
3 g      ground cinnamon
2 g      ground ginger
1 g      ground clove
6 g      vanilla
2 g      sea salt
1 g      fresh ground nutmeg

instructions

  • mix together puree, [[caramelized-milk]], eggs, and spices
  • pour into pie-crust
